titleInfo.title: Photograph of Bishop Keith with General Assembly, 1961

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A black and white photograph of Chief Overseer Bishop Keith with the bishops of the House of God 1961 General Assembly, at the House of God Church in Nashville, Tennessee. The Bishops are arranged in two loose rows, with five sitting in front and two standing on either side, and four standing in the back row. Sitting from right to left: Bishop Sally (S. A.) Fleeting (Connecticut), Bishop Keith (wearing graduation robes), Bishop Horace Avery (Ohio), Bishop James W. Jenkins, Bishop George Morgan (Connecticut); Standing left to right: Bishop W. H. Davis; Bishop Maurice Beard Sr., Bishop W. L. Nelson (South Carolina), Bishop Julius R. Lockley, Bishop P. J. (Philip Joseph) Fletcher, Bishop Henry Loyd Harrison. Inscribed on the lower left corner is "The House of God, etc. 1961 General Assembly, Bishop M.F.L. Keith, Chief Overseer." Bishop Keith passed away in 1962, shortly after this General Assembly. Bishop Keith would often dress in a suit jacket and tie with a long skirt, or in graduation gowns. Women leaders who served on her council began dressing that way, as well. Bishop Keith did this to make a point about her equality and standing with men. Dr. Mary F.L. Keith (unknown -1962) succeeded Mother Mary Magdalena Lewis Tate as the second Chief Overseer of the House of God Church in 1931. She was an educator and philanthropist and under her administration the House of God Church greatly enhanced its social services and programs; expanded its real estate holdings; and increased membership. Under her direction, the church printed the First Universal Sunday School Lessons, and founded the Keith Bible Institute; the House of God Home for Children in East Chattanooga, Tennessee; and the House of God Home. The House of God, Which is the Church of the Living God, the Pillar and Ground of the Truth Without Controversy, Inc. was founded by Mother Mary Magdalena Lewis Tate with the help of Bishop Keith, her secretary who would go on to be the second leader of the church after Mother Tate died. Mother Tate incorporated the church in 1908. After her death in 1930, the church split into three dominions, Jewell, Keith, and Lewis Dominions. The church took on the name House of God Church Keith Dominion at this point, named after Bishop Keith. It is headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee.
